content:
Dear all,

ItaCa Fest is back again, and ready for 2023! As in the previous editions, the Fest collects a wide range of topics and gives voice to a large number of communities.

The first date of the ItaCa Fest will be April 27, 2023 at 3 pm (Italian time) featuring:

15:00 - Tobias Fritz,
15:40 - Elena Di Lavore
16:20 - Davide Trotta

The zoom link is the following: https://stockholmuniversity.zoom.us/j/68792232558
While the Fest website is this one: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/pages/fest23.html

The Fest will continue with other meetings in May, June, September, October and November, with other amazing speakers, such as Awodey, Escardo, Freni, Gambino, Henry, Koudenburg, Menni, Guffanti, Wrigley, Volpe.

Join us (and bring a friend)!

Cheers,
Beppe, Ivan, Fosco, Paolo and Greta.

Matteo Capucci (he/him) said:

Dear all,

ItaCa Fest is back again, and ready for 2023! As in the previous editions, the Fest collects a wide range of topics and gives voice to a large number of communities.

The first date of the ItaCa Fest will be April 27, 2023 at 3 pm (Italian time) featuring:

15:00 - Tobias Fritz,
15:40 - Elena Di Lavore
16:20 - Davide Trotta

The zoom link is the following: https://stockholmuniversity.zoom.us/j/68792232558
While the Fest website is this one: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/pages/fest22.html

Should be 23

Hey all. The link displayed above is incorrect. Please use this one instead:
https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376
Meeting ID: 978 7837 6376
Sorry about that :astonished:

Another episode of our seminar series: the next date of the ItaCa Fest will be June 16 2023, at 3 pm CEST.

We will be hosting three amazing talks

15:00 - 15:40 E. Vitale, "The completion under strong homotopy cokernels"
15:40 - 16:20 J. R. Gonzales, "Bicategorical presentations of étendues"
16:20 - 17:00 A. Cappelletti, "Protoadditive functors and pretorsion theories in multipointed context"

at the following link:
https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09

As always, we welcome a good discussion and you can stick with us for a chat after the last talk.

You can find the abstracts and more on our seminar at the Fest's page:

https://progetto-itaca.github.io/pages/fest23.html

Hope to see you soon!

Cheers,

Beppe, Ivan, Fosco, Paolo and Greta.
